thread.title: Youth to be sentenced as adult over fatal crash
thread.title_full: Youth to be sentenced as adult over fatal crash

author: Candice Prosser
title: Youth to be sentenced as adult over fatal crash
text:
Map: Bedford Park 5042 
An Adelaide teenager will be sentenced as an adult over crashing a stolen car at high speed and killing a woman in another vehicle involved. 
The boy, 15, previously pleaded guilty to offences including causing death by dangerous driving and causing harm to two other motorists who were injured in the fiery crash. 
The teenager, who cannot be named, stole a utility from a house at Morphett Vale and crashed into three cars at the northern end of the Southern Expressway at Bedford Park, killing 48-year-old Nicole Tucker. 
Prosecutors applied for adult sentencing based on the gravity of the offending and the boy's criminal history of more than 60 offences. 
Youth Court senior judge Penelope Eldridge granted the application and the boy is to face the Adelaide District Court in March. 
A 17-year-old boy who was a passenger in the stolen utility earlier pleaded guilty to charges and is due to be sentenced in the Youth Court in a fortnight.
